todos.title: Roadblocks
todos.body: Write down what prevents you from achieving those goals.

todos.title: 3 year goals
todos.body: What it feels and looks like to work at the company in three years and what type of numbers you are hitting.

todos.title: Sound Goal
todos.body: Verify that your outcome is ecologically sound and desirable, it must benefit you and other people.

todos.title: 90 day rocks
todos.body: Usually include 3-5 medium projects you want to accomplish in each quarter that get you to your 1 year goal (we are in Q2 - April to June)

todos.title: Review Rules
todos.body: Review your goals with the rules above.

todos.title: Four Most Important
todos.body: Pick out the four most important goals for this year and write down why you will absolutely achieve them.

todos.title: Resources
todos.body: Make a list of important resources you already have at your disposal.  Focus on times you’ve used those resources most skillfully.

todos.title: Evidence Procedure Rule
todos.body: Have an evidence procedure (what will outcome look like).

todos.title: Traction Goals
todos.body: Goals should be in 10y, 3y, 1y, 90day, and 1week, 1day

todos.title: Timing
todos.body: Estimate when you plan to achieve each outcome.

todos.title: Physiology
todos.body: Describe the kind of person you would need to be to fulfill those goals.

todos.title: 10 year goals
todos.body: Big hairy audacious dreams (ex  be on the cover of Sport’s Illustrated)

todos.title: Specific Terms Rule
todos.body: Be as specific as possible, how does your outcome, look, sound, feel, smell, exactly when will you achieve it.

todos.title: Always Prioritize
todos.body: All goals should be prioritized meaning the most important are listed first and you always work on the most important (there is a common misconception that the most important goals things should be reactive items like putting out fires but instead they should be proactive)

todos.title: Be in control
todos.body: Your outcome must be initiated and maintained by you.  It cannot be dependent upon another specific person.

todos.title: Develop Models
todos.body: Write down three to five people who have achieved what you want and specify words or behaviors that made them successful.  Close your eyes and imagine each of these people giving you advice.

todos.title: Atmosphere
todos.body: What does your home environment need to accomplish these goals.  Design your perfect environment.  What tools would you need, what does it look like, smell, feel, sound like.

todos.title: Breaking Down Goals
todos.body: The best way to accomplish a big hairy audacious goal is to break it down into smaller goals leading up to what are you going to do today.

todos.title: Daily high pay off activities or high value targets (HPA/HVT)
todos.body: The 3-5 tasks you want to get done each day to help achieve your weekly scorecards and quarterly rocks

todos.title: Imagine Better and It Will Happen
todos.body: Take your finger, point it out, and swing it behind you and see how far you can rotate, now imagine in your mind going further and swing your arm back around, do it again.

todos.title: Plan
todos.body: Take four most important goals and write down a step by step plan.

todos.title: Positive Terms Rule
todos.body: State outcome in positive terms (what you want to happen, not what you want to avoid).

todos.title: Weekly scorecard measurable
todos.body: Numbers you should track each week (think if you were a CEO on vacation and someone came to you and handed you only a sheet of numbers about your business, what would need to be on there for you to determine if you stay an extra week or need to head home)

todos.title: Dreams
todos.body: Make an inventory of your dreams (things you want to have , do, be, and share)

todos.title: Gratitude Diary
todos.body: Make a list of things that you already have that were once goals.

todos.title: Set and Forget
todos.body: In time you will be so good at setting goals that you will be able to set them and forget them (in other words, its not a great practice to be constantly changing your goals mid term).  That said, you should never start a goal if you know that it is no longer a priority or value added.

todos.title: Binary v. Quantative
todos.body: Goals can be measured by yes or no (project oriented goals such as Implementing CRM) or by numbers (quantitative goals such as on-board 25 customers)

todos.title: 1 year goals
todos.body: Focused on big picture projects, project development milestones, fundraising, cash flow, revenue, profit, customers, etc. that get you to your 3 year goal

todos.title: Ideal Day
todos.body: Create your ideal day to achieve these goals.

todos.title: Goals
todos.body: A study was done following a large graduate class at Yale.  The study found that the 3 percent of the class that had written goals were worth more than the entire other 97%.  When the mind has a target it will focus and refocus until it completes its target.

todos.title: Qualitative Goals
todos.body: A qualitative goal is the type that is felt more than measured. The achievement of such goals is not based on measurable terms but on the impact of the satisfaction and worth it creates on a person (usually a manager, customer, team, survey group, etc).
